title: 114_s278
content: The "Citizen Empowerment Act" is cited as the short title. Part III of title 5, United States Code, is amended by adding a new chapter 79A for services to members of the public. Procedures for in-person and telephonic interactions conducted by executive branch employees are defined in this section as interactions related to possible violations of federal statutes or regulations that could lead to penalties or fines. The term 'State' refers to various regions within the United States, while 'telephonic' pertains to communication via phone or electronic device. Employees of Executive agencies must allow individuals to record interactions at their own expense. Employees of Executive agencies conducting covered interactions can record the interaction after informing the individual and providing a transcript upon request with reimbursement. Before any covered interaction, an employee must inform the individual of their rights under this section. Before or at an initial covered interaction, an individual must be provided with a verbal or written notice of their rights under this section. Separate notifications are required for separate violations. Official representatives or those holding power of attorney can represent individuals in making audio recordings of covered interactions with Executive agency employees. An individual making an audio recording during a covered interaction with an Executive agency employee has the right to receive a transcript or copy of the recording, same notice as the individual, and same rights regarding the recording as the individual. The individual has rights to audio recordings made during interactions with Executive agency employees, including ownership of the recordings. There is no private right of action created by this section, and exceptions apply for classified information, public safety, and criminal investigations. The individual has rights to audio recordings made during interactions with Executive agency employees, including ownership of the recordings. Exceptions apply for classified information, public safety, and ongoing criminal investigations conducted by Federal law enforcement officers. Employees must notify individuals if exceptions apply to their interactions. The section allows for audio recordings of interactions with Executive agency employees, supersedes certain laws related to recording interactions, and outlines disciplinary action for violating the section. The section 79A allows for services to members of the public.
